body: I photographed two koalas on this walk.
A smaller breakfast this morning - scrambled egg on sour dough toast with bacon extra. I gave some of the bacon to Anita who had the same except for the egg being poached.
Anita drive the BYD Shark to the start of the Toohey Forest walk this morning.
Drove Katherine to her City Beach holiday casual job interview.
Koalas everywhere and this is the time I don’t bring my camera!
We’re here too early for coffee
I saw a duck and dog stickers on the wall. It turns out this is a Brisbane think with others reporting sighting at other Southside locations.
Our usual breakfast spot.
Took the coffee and cake to the Colmslie Reserve. Discovered a small beach beside the river. There were people already there
The Shark was down to 25% SOC, so I decided to go to a DC charger and get it back up to around 80%. While it was charging I went around to Autobarn and bought some claybars and assorted bungie cords.

This is one of the cheapest places to buy petrol in Brisbane.

Over a distance of 660.5 kms, I used 22.33 litres of 95RON. The refuel session was priced at $1.739 per litre ($28.83). That’s a consumption figure of 3.38 Litres/100Km.
We caught up with all our relatives and had lunch there. Anita and I had the Salmon and Katherine chose the bolognaise Rigoletti.

Katherine needed a combination lock for the locker they make available at the City Beach Warehouse. Anita wanted to buy a new basic sprinkler.

This was an opportunity to restock on AAA batteries which we ran out of earlier in the week.

The TV dinner that Katherine was going to eat had too much cheese in it, so I agreed to go to MacDonalds to buy something else.

I ordered an apple pie for myself and used the Maccas App for the first time in ages.
Dropped off the Shark at TJM for the canopy fitting
Ordered takeaway coffee and sat under one of the new picnic tables
Ordered take-away coffee
Drove home to get the Canon 5D Mk IV and the 600mm lens. I’m determined to get some good photos of the koalas.
We came across a group of bird photographers waiting to get some photos of a Kite. It has a big nest in a tree near the water storage tank.
We’re back for another walk up Mt Gravatt. I didn’t bring the large camera because I was satisfied with the photos from yesterday, but I brought the mirrorless camera just in case.

We encountered a whole family of koalas in a nearby tree. They weren’t even very far up the tree, in fact all three koalas were on the same branch. There was the father, mother and a juvenile.

I even managed to get some video of them.
We drop Katherine off at the old museum for the QYO auditions. Her audition is later at 11:00am, but she is also helping out.
We have some time to kill, so we go out to Cleveland for coffee and end up at the park near the Cleveland Ferry Terminal.

I hadn’t charged the Shark overnight, and wasn’t planning on the trip to Cleveland. Since we still had to go back to the old museum, I needed to DC charge to avoid using petrol.

The extra complication now is the additional height of the Ute master roof rack at almost 2 metres. The height bar at the Cleveland Shopping Centre is 2.0 metres.

Anita got out to let me know how close the rack was. She didn’t think it was that close!
The charging session was going to take about 30 minutes, so we head upstairs and then go for a walk around the area to pass the time.
We were worried that there wouldn’t be anywhere to park, but luckily there was a couple of spots left down in the park.
We end up at the Coffee Club for lunch. This time also includes Katherine’s shopping at various places at the Shopping Centre.

A wild storm came through Brisbane but there wasn’t much at Wishart. When I went out to the Shark, I was surprised to discover that water has gotten inside the new canopy! It appeared to be coming through the bolts in the ceiling. There is supposed to be sealant around the contact areas!

I send Mark at TJM an email with some photos.
We are at the Venman Bushland Park. The trail bikers were out in force back at the quarry. There were vehicles parked everywhere!

We are back at the picnic area. I get all the gear to make tea and coffee. The butcher birds and magpies come down to annoy us! One jumps up on our table and it startles me; I spilled my tea on the new chair!

They poop on Anita’s chair!

A Tawny Frogmouth suddenly appears on the ground with it’s wings spread on the ground. It was also being pestered by the other birds and eventually flies back up into a nearby tree where we see another Frogmouth roosting there.

The sit so still and a perfectly camouflaged. If it wasn’t for the other birds harassment, you would never know they were there!

I place the security camera on the ground near the fence this evening because Anita wants to know what is digging up the garden at night.

Nothing recorded

The forest is very dry with some parts already burnt. The water level is way down in the billabong but still has blooming water Lillie’s.

The only wildlife so far was a juvenile frilly lizard.
The Supernumerary was really busy so we ended up at Maccas for breakfast.
Anita spotted a carpet snake high up in a tree above the carpark.
We’re going to another caravan show, so I think it’s cheaper if we take advantage of my hospital car pass if we park at Mater and the catch a bus to RBWH.
We are at another caravan show. Since this is a Brisbane event, more companies should be here.
